snippet: A truncated “I’m not concerned about the very poor” comment was seized on as showing Mitt Romney to be out of touch.
abstract: Mitt Romney's comment that he is 'not concerned about the very poor' is seized upon by his critics as the latest example of spoken gaffes by the candidate; comment dominates political talk shows, in part because it seems to encapsulate the degree to which Romney, worth an estimated $200 million, is out of touch and unable to relate to struggling Americans.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Reno, Nev.

lead_paragraph: A truncated “I’m not concerned about the very poor” comment was seized on as showing Mitt Romney to be out of touch.

headline.seo: ‘Poor’ Quote by Romney Seized on by His Critics
headline.main: ‘Poor’ Quote by Romney Joins a List Critics Love
headline.print_headline: ‘Poor’ Quote By Romney Joins a List Critics Love
